channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY

  • Description: SequenceEvent: While the package unloaded package handler found it was leaking and inform the QA staff, and kitty litter were used to cover the leakage and package was put in the plastic bag and send it to hazmat damage area. DescribePack: The plastic bottle cap was loose and result in internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: kitty litter were used to cover the leakage and package was put in the plastic bag and send it to hazmat damage area.

Transportation by road has been confirmed. Shipment also contains UN1266, Perfumery products, Class 3 Single Package or Inner Packaging(if any): Packaging Type: Bottle s Material of Construction: Glass Package Capacity: 15 mi Amount in Package: 15 mi Number in Shipment 1 Number Failed: 1

item.title: Report E-2023100305
item.description:
Report E-2023100305

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 9/28/2023 a Veolia employee unloading drums from a truck into another trailer at the Veolia, Schenectady, NY 10 day intransit facility when the employee noticed that a 14 gallon fiber drum was stained and damp. The 14 gallon drum contained a 2.5 gallon glass bottle of Formic Acid With Not Less Than 5% But Less Than 10% Acid By Mass corrosive liquids. The outer container was opened and the inner container was inspected and was found to be broken and released its contents. No liquid was released from the outer packaging drum. The 14 gallon drum containing the broken glass bottle was overpacked into an 30 gallon 1H2 drum and transportation to the ultimate disposal facility was continued. The drum did not leak any amount of the corrosive liquid solution out of the outer container.
